title: Exhibition Review: Empty Walls
body:
Walking down the riff raff of City Road everyday can become a little grinding on ones perspective of life.

At first, I enjoyed the sensuous cocktail of cheap shampoo, leaking beer kegs, rotating kebab pillars and your local shishamans breath, but there’s only so many cocktails one can take till nausea comes-a-knockin’.

Luckily in life, there’s this beautiful thing called alchemy, which the Cardiff based collective,** Modern Alchemists**, have pioneered to inject colour and culture on the streets of Roath.

_**Empty Walls** _is a public art project, celebrating the creativity and democratistaion of urban art for local and international artists. Unfortunately, I missed the grand finale tour the Alchemists conducted, however, I took on my own quest one sunny autumnal afternoon, map in hand, to go on some kind of art-easter-egg hunt. I found no chocolate but saw many visual treats – _on da streets. _

Keep your eyeballs peeled for future happenings of the Alchemists. Anything that can _ease the queases_ of City Road seductions are winners in my book.
